This blog has been a constant source of inspiration for me the past few years so I was overjoyed when this book landed on my desk! It truly is a manual for the considered home which to me means a space that not only looks great but also functions. That, in my opinion, is everything. Creative ideas (many of which are inexpensive) abound in this book, and will have you inspired! - Summer

This is the book to own this year! Since its birth in 1913, Vanity Fair has been the witty, cosmopolitan voice of the era. Revel in the magazine’s storied history decade by decade, from the decadent Jazz Age to the modern age. With captivating images that defined the century, Vanity Fair 100 Years is a book you will proudly display and pore over at every spare moment. - Summer

A beautiful, perfectly woven tale of family, politics, love, taboo and duty. I was swept away from the first page into complete reader bliss. Nominated for the Man Booker Prize and the National Book Award, this book deserves to win them both. - Summer

item.title: A Tale for the Time Being
item.dc:creator: athompson

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This book is part suicide note, part puzzle, part gift. It unfolds beautifully and is one of the most interesting books I’ve ever read. There is all kinds of magic inside these pages, including the main character. Noa, a Japanese teenager, her famous 104-year-old Great Aunt, a Buddhist monk who tries to Nao find her “SUPAPAWA,” and a middle-aged novelist who intercepts Nao’s diary after the tsunami on the British Colombian island where she lives. You will be blown away by Rush Ozeki’s imagination and how she weaves such a a fascinating tale together. - Summer

Taxidermy is back after being out of fashion for almost a half a century! It has made a massive come-back in the past few years as you have probably noticed as seen n high fashion and jewelry ad campaigns, the homes of artists, stylists and interior designers. This book marks the first time taxidermy is considered an art from unto itself as it calls upon historical settings as well as how it works so beautifully with contemporary environments in the incredible pictures throughout. This book is a jewel not to be missed. - Summer
Attention! Attention! I have not been this thrilled, sucked in, and in love with a book like this in... er, maybe ever. Please buy, love and pass on this book. - Summer

Donna Tart is a favorite novelist of mine. In 'The Secret History' she spins an amazing tale of a tight-knit, unorthodox group of 5 set in a small liberal arts college in Vermont. I love this book for so many reasons: It is about college life, it has an experiment gone wrong (ie the murder), they are obsessed by Greek Mythology and the characters are either beautiful or moneyed. What can I say, in my book this is a recipe for a great read! - Summer

item.title: The Kinfolk Table : Recipes for Small Gatherings
item.dc:creator: aldaga

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: by Nathan Williams and Rebecca Parker Payne and Parker Fitzgerald and Leo Patrone

As described by the masters at Kinfolk their first cookbook is 'One-third cookbook, one-third narrative tale and one-third international adventure.' This book brings the focus back to the intimacy of entertaining and shares simple but lovely recipes and tales from around the world. KINFOLK TABLE is a gem not to be missed. -Summer

This book excites me more than anything! Fashion and life inspiration abounds in this amazing book about Grannies. From A-Z you will be entertained and dazzled by the most awesome of the age-ed around. Prepare to fall in love. xx - Summer

I fell in love with this Scottish band after seeing Murdoch's premiere of 'God Help The Girl' at Sundance. They start recording a new album in March but until then, I give you their latest album to get you primed and ready . . . . - Summer

After reading 'Crossing To Safety,' a favorite book of mine, I wanted to read another of Stegner's novels. 'Angle of Repose' gives us a look at four generations of a family in the American West. It won a well deserved Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1972. - Summer
Prepare to fall in love with Little Onion, a young boy who poses as a girl and rides with Captain John Brown as they help fight slavery. The Good Lord Bird is fabulously, unexpectedly funny! - Summer

A long-term project by photographer Jimmy Nelson gives us the unique opportunity to discover more than 30 secluded and slowly vanishing tribes from all over the world. Jimmy spent two weeks with each tribe and immersed himself in their rituals, culture and climates. This is the most fascinating and beautiful book I have ever laid eyes on. Truly a book to be cherished and passed down. - Summer

A peek inside an old friendship between Natalie and Leah, both a different race and both growing up in North West London in a housing project. Leah studied philosophy and works at a shabby non profit while married to a French hairdresser. Natalie becomes a high powered attorney with a husband who hails from wealth. New zip codes, money, and degree's' . . . but does anyone ever really 'get out' of where they originated? If so, does it make them happy? - Summer

This absolutely gripping novel will have you hooked from the start! Set on a small town beach in Australia, an older woman is living out her years peacefully when a government caregiver shows up out of the blue to help. The Night Guest is about so much more than character maladies, manipulation and a crime. McFarlane delicately weaves these in with love, trust and dependence. This first time novelist has an almost mythical quality about her writing that is so attractive to me. - Summer

Transcendental Meditation became popular in the 60's after the Beatles put it on the map and since then everyone from Oprah to Martin Scorsese and many other titans in their respective fields have heralded the amazing effects this type of meditation can have on your life. Having practiced this type of meditation for a year now I can tell you in earnest it is an amazing technique that can bring you more clarity, lower your stress levels and allow you to have moments of serenity in a world that doesn't make that easy. - Summer

'Kinfolk: Discovering new things to cook, make and do' holds a special place in my heart. It comes four times a year and it is a beautiful production to be cherished. The pages are heavy, the colors are beautiful and each issue has a theme such as "Home," "Summer Travels & Traditions," and "Age." This publication is chock full of essays, photographs, ideas, paintings, and advice that is beloved. When I want to escape and do something for myself I pick up Kinfolk, turn on the jazz and hop in the bathtub! - Summer

Here at Summer Says we like to be discerning about the things we read but sometimes you need a little ridiculousness in your life and who better to get it from than Chelsea Handler. This book will have you feeling better about yourself in no time! Chelsea regales us with her insane humor and absurd stories from Africa to Switzerland and many spots in between. Thanks to her for helping us take our lives just a little less seriously. - Summer

item.title: Leroy Grannis: Surf Photography of the 1960's and 1970's
item.dc:creator: aldaga

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Boards, bathing suits, vintage cars, waves and beautiful people, what more could you want? With this book you can take a vacation to paradise in a bygone era anytime you desire. Summertime please hurry up! - Summer
Matt Zoller Seitz and Michael Chabon

In honor of Anderson's new movie, The Grand Budapest Hotel, we present and support this fabulous collection of everything Wes.Here we can celebrate his playful, quirky and ingenious imagination anytime we like with this first ever detailed filmography of all his films. Gwynnie's style in Royal Tenenbaums will forever be an inspiration to me. Here's to you Wes . . . . - Summer

item.title: Shake: A New Perspective on Cocktails
item.dc:creator: aldaga

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: I love a good cocktail and am quite picky about the ingredients being fresh and if possible, organic and local! The move to eating this way is mainstream and the lovely boys from Shake are equipping you with the book and tools to make fabulous drinks at home. Cocktail hour has never felt so good. - Summer
A little boy's crayons have gone on strike and each color has its reason. This smart and witty book is the current favorite of my oldest daughters and will soon be yours too! - Summer

Another fabulous installment from The Selby takes us into the hearts and minds of some very fashion forward people from around the world. This book is pure fun and fantasy with high-brow and home-spun all mixed together which makes it interesting and relatable which fashion often times is not. Todd Selby has a keen eye and is a master editor of content. Read on and enjoy! – Summer

This book is so good I didn't want it to end. We meet Inez Ruin, a young girl growing up between LA, with her bombshell mom, and San Francisco with her bon vivant of a father. You fall in love with the whole Ruin clan and experience through her eyes what it meant to grow up in California on the 70's. One of my favorite books of all time & my beach read pick of the summer! - Summer

This is a nice and easy beach read. A young couple (Walter & Alice) are expecting their first baby and move to the condo of the Alice's recently deceased aunt because Walter has just lost his job in North Carolina. Eccentricity abounds as you meet the wife's sister and brother-in-law and he introduces Walter to the new 'job' he has lined up for him. This book is funny and full of truth about family craziness that often comes along with that and rolling with the punches. - Summer

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: nike mercurial vapor Hi, just wanted to say, I loved this post. It was helpful. Keep on posting!|

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This book is told through letters, love letters to be exact. Some of them the most beautiful love letters I have ever read. It takes you back to the times, right at the start when you were just falling in love. It pulls from your memory what it meant to be in so deep in love you couldn't see straight. On the other side it reminds you how it feels falling out of love in despair and how life continues to surprise but at the same time gives you just what you need. Pure joy and magic! - Summer

Once you pick up this book you will be enveloped into another world where little girls are made to look like boys so they aren't kidnapped by drug lords. In Guerrero, Mexico our heroine, Ladydi takes you into her unforgettable world and you won't be able to stop turning the pages until THE END. The subject matter may not seem attractive but trust me, this beautifully written novel will impress you beyond measure. - Summer
